byline.docAuthor: J. Mulzer, A. K. Kermanchahi, J. Buschmann, P. Luger

docTitle.titlePart:
Asymmetric Synthesis of ent-Corey Lactone Alcohol and its 12-(all-cis)-and
1 1-Epimers via Free Radical 5-exo-trig-C,C Cyclization

byline.docAuthor: Johann Mulzer"', Abdul Kader KermanchahP, Jiirgen Buschmannb, and Peter Lugerb

byline.affiliation: Institut fur Organische Chemie der Freien Universitat Berlin",
Institut fur Kristallographie und Mineralogie der Freien Universitat Berlinb,

front.keyword: Key Words: Corey lactone I Prostaglandins I Free radical cyclization / Glyceraldehyde, (R)-isopropylidene I Radicals
front.div:
Asymmetric eight-step syntheses are reported for the ent-Co-
rey lactone alcohol derivatives 3a-d and their epimers 4a-d
and 14a, b from (R)-2,3-isopropylidene glyceraldehyde (5) as
the starting material. The key step of the synthesis is the free
radical cyclization of the butenolide thiocarbonates 11, 12
and 13. This reaction produces 3 and 4 in ratios between
5 7 ~ 4 3 and 30:70 from 11 and 12, whereas 14a and 14b are
generated from 13 in a ratio of 19:81. From 3d the prostanoid
enone 18 is prepared via the configurationally stable alde-
hyde 17.
Corey lactone alcohol (1) and its 0-protected derivatives
have served as central intermediates in the total synthesis
of prostanoids for more than twenty years. In consequence,
an incredible number of synthetic approaches to these com-
pounds have been reported[']. However, there is only one
synthesis for 2, the all-cis epimer of 1I21, and other epimers
of 1 are unknown as yet. We describe a new method for the
preparation of 1, 2 and two other epimers in form of the
0-protected unnatural enantiomers 3,4a-e and 14a, b. The
key step of our synthesis is the formation of the 8,12-bond
(prostanoid numbering) via a free radical cyclizati~n[~],
Scheme 1. Bn = benzyl, Bz = benzoyl, TBDMS = tert-butyldimeth-
ylsilyl, TBDPS = tert-butyldiphenylsilyl
